definitions: covered or overgrown with ferns, creating a lush green appearance
having characteristics similar to ferns, especially delicate frond-like patterns
examples: The ferny glade was cool and peaceful
They walked through the ferny undergrowth
The ferny pattern on the wallpaper was elegant
Her ferny handwriting had delicate curves

definitions: savagely fierce, cruel, or violent in nature or appearance
extremely intense or severe in degree, manner, or effect
examples: The ferocious tiger stalked its prey
His ferocious temper frightened everyone
The ferocious storm destroyed several buildings
She faced ferocious competition for the position

definitions: containing or relating to iron, especially with a valence of two
examples: Ferrous metals are attracted to magnets
The ferrous sulfate supplement helped her anemia

definitions: producing or capable of producing abundant vegetation or crops
capable of producing offspring or bearing young successfully
producing many ideas, results, or new developments productively
examples: The fertile valley produced excellent harvests
Fertile soil is essential for farming
The fertile female laid dozens of eggs
They hoped she would be fertile after treatment
His fertile imagination created wonderful stories
It was fertile ground for innovation

definitions: having or displaying passionate intensity of feeling, belief, or support
examples: Her fervent prayers were answered at last
He was a fervent supporter of the cause

definitions: relating to or appropriate for a festival or celebration
cheerfully celebratory in mood, appearance, or atmosphere
examples: The festive season brings families together
Festive decorations filled the streets
Everyone was in a festive mood tonight
The festive atmosphere was contagious

definitions: relating to or characteristic of a fetus during prenatal development
examples: Fetal development occurs over nine months
The fetal position helps conserve warmth

definitions: attractively appealing in appearance, especially in a charming or pretty way
examples: She wore a fetching blue dress tonight
His fetching smile won everyone over

definitions: relating to the medieval European system of feudalism and its social hierarchy
examples: The feudal system dominated medieval Europe
Feudal lords controlled vast estates

definitions: having or showing symptoms of fever with elevated body temperature
displaying nervous excitement or frantic energy in activity or emotion
examples: The feverish child needed immediate medical attention
Her feverish skin felt burning hot
There was feverish activity before the deadline
He worked at a feverish pace

definitions: the smallest number or amount possible, representing the superlative of few
examples: This route has the fewest traffic lights
She made the fewest mistakes in class

definitions: having an otherworldly, magical, or fairy-like quality that seems strange
giving an impression of vague unworldliness or being fated to die soon
examples: Her fey beauty seemed almost supernatural
The fey music drifted through the forest
He had a fey look before the accident
There was something fey about her behavior

definitions: containing, consisting of, or resembling fibers in structure or texture
examples: The fibrous vegetables provided good dietary fiber
Fibrous tissue formed around the wound

definitions: frequently changing one's loyalties, interests, or affections without reason
examples: The fickle crowd turned against their hero
Fickle weather made planning difficult

definitions: existing only in imagination or as part of a work of fiction
examples: The fictional characters seemed incredibly real
She created a fictional world in her novel

definitions: not real or true, being imaginary, invented, or fabricated deliberately
examples: He gave a fictitious name to the police
The company used fictitious accounts

definitions: created by or relating to imagination rather than real life
examples: The author's fictive universe was compelling
Fictive kinship bonds unite the community

definitions: annoyingly trivial or petty in size, importance, or nature
examples: Stop wasting time on fiddling details
The fiddling amount wasn't worth arguing about

definitions: involving trust, especially regarding the relationship between trustee and beneficiary
examples: The lawyer had fiduciary responsibilities to clients
Fiduciary duty requires acting in good faith

definitions: violently aggressive or frightening in temperament or action
showing powerful intensity or extreme strength of feeling or effect
examples: The fierce dog guarded the property
She faced fierce opposition
The fierce storm lasted three days
Competition was fierce among the candidates

definitions: consisting of fire or burning with intense heat like flames
having a passionate, quick-tempered, or spirited nature
examples: The fiery furnace melted the metal
A fiery sunset painted the sky
Her fiery temper was legendary
He gave a fiery speech to supporters

definitions: amounting to the cardinal number that is five more than ten
examples: Fifteen students attended the special class
She waited fifteen minutes for the bus

definitions: constituting number fifteen in a sequence or ordered series
examples: The fifteenth century saw major discoveries
Her fifteenth birthday was next week

definitions: constituting number five in a sequence or ordered series
examples: The fifth grade students performed a play
She finished fifth in the race

definitions: constituting number fifty in a sequence or ordered series
examples: Their fiftieth anniversary was truly special
The fiftieth edition included new content

definitions: amounting to the cardinal number that is five times ten
examples: Fifty people attended the wedding reception
The temperature reached fifty degrees today

definitions: engaged in or relating to physical combat or warfare
having a combative spirit or being ready to fight
examples: The fighting forces advanced at dawn
Fighting broke out in the streets
She's in fighting form after recovery
He maintained his fighting spirit

definitions: relating to or consisting of human or animal figures in art
examples: The figural paintings depicted ancient battles
Figural sculpture dominated the exhibition

definitions: departing from literal use of words to create metaphorical meaning
examples: His figurative language painted vivid pictures
The figurative meaning differed from literal

definitions: decorated with a design, pattern, or representational figures
examples: The figured silk had beautiful floral designs
She wore figured velvet to the gala

definitions: relating to or befitting a son or daughter in relationship to parents
examples: His filial duty required caring for parents
She showed filial devotion throughout life

definitions: containing something to capacity or having all available space occupied
examples: The filled balloons floated toward ceiling
Every filled seat meant sold-out success

definitions: recorded on motion picture film or video for viewing
covered with a thin layer or film of substance
examples: The filmed interview aired last night
Their filmed wedding was professionally edited
His filmed eyes showed signs of illness
The filmed surface needed careful cleaning

definitions: disgustingly dirty, covered with or characterized by filth
obscene, offensive, or morally disgusting in nature or content
examples: The filthy room hadn't been cleaned for months
His filthy clothes needed immediate washing
She objected to his filthy language
The filthy joke offended everyone present

definitions: coming at the end of a series, process, or period
allowing no further doubt, dispute, or change in decision
examples: The final chapter revealed the mystery
Today is the final day of school
The judge's decision was final
Her final answer couldn't be changed

definitions: relating to finance, money management, or monetary resources and affairs
examples: Financial planning helps secure your future
The company faced financial difficulties

definitions: of high quality, skill, or appearance that is excellent
very thin in thickness, texture, or diameter
in good health or satisfactory condition
subtle and requiring careful discrimination or perception
examples: The fine wine was worth the price
She wore her finest jewelry tonight
The fine thread broke easily
Fine sand covered the beach
I'm feeling fine after the surgery
Everything will be fine tomorrow
There's a fine line between confidence and arrogance
The fine details made the difference

definitions: of higher quality or more refined than something being compared
examples: The finer details required careful attention
She appreciated the finer things in life

definitions: having fingers of a specified kind or number mentioned
examples: The three-fingered glove was specially made
Long-fingered hands played the piano beautifully

definitions: brought to completion or conclusion with nothing more needed
having no more opportunity, completely defeated or ruined
examples: The finished product looked professional
Her finished manuscript was ready for publication
After that scandal, his career was finished
They were finished as a couple

definitions: having definite limits or bounds, not infinite in extent
examples: Earth's resources are finite and precious
We have finite time to complete this

definitions: dismissed from employment, typically for cause or economic reasons
hardened or glazed by heating in a kiln or furnace
examples: The fired employee cleared his desk
Several workers were fired last month
The fired pottery was ready for sale
These fired bricks are very durable

definitions: able to resist fire or great heat without burning or damage
examples: The fireproof safe protected important documents
Fireproof materials are required by code

definitions: having a solid, stable surface or structure that resists pressure
showing steadfast determination or strength of purpose without wavering
examples: The firm mattress supported her back well
Stand on firm ground before lifting
She maintained a firm commitment to justice
His firm handshake conveyed confidence

definitions: born first among siblings in a family
examples: Their firstborn child inherited the estate
The firstborn son had special responsibilities

definitions: coming from direct personal experience or observation rather than secondhand
examples: She had firsthand knowledge of the situation
His firsthand account was most reliable

definitions: relating to government revenue, especially taxes and public spending
examples: The fiscal year ends in December
Fiscal policy affects economic growth

definitions: having the smell, taste, or characteristics of fish
arousing suspicion or doubt about honesty or truth
examples: The fishy smell came from the market
This soup tastes too fishy
Something fishy is going on here
His story sounded fishy to me

definitions: capable of undergoing nuclear fission when bombarded by neutrons
examples: Fissile material requires careful handling
Uranium-235 is a fissile isotope

definitions: in good physical condition through exercise and proper health
suitable or appropriate for a particular purpose or situation
examples: Regular exercise keeps you fit and healthy
She's fit enough to run marathons
This candidate is fit for the position
The house isn't fit for habitation
